results.title: VIPER
results.description:
The very cornerstone of our lifestyle, we believe that no project is too little not to be implemented following VIPER architecture.

We are also proficient with MVVM.

results.title: VPN
results.description:
Nowadays, it is vital to protect both our connections and our data.

Thus, we have learned the ways of the VPN and several of its protocols like OpenVPN or WireGuard.

results.title: SOLID
results.description:
Far beyond the acronym, we hold the SOLID principles as our dogma.

We split our code into responsibilities and drive them to a single testable and scalable functionality, making it easier to expand our projects in the future.

results.title: TDD
results.description: Because we use VIPER architecture and we split our functionalities through several Services and Interactors, we follow a Test Driven Development to make sure before implementing any component we have clear the successful and failing cases.

results.title: UI
results.description:
From the Objective-C dark times, through the UIKit and Autolayoutâ€™s gray era, to SwiftUI's golden moment.

We feel proud knowing we can implement almost every possible UI style.

results.title: API
results.description:
There is no way to expand your project across the net without a proper API. We love to implement our API Client services with the help of Alamofire.
We greatly appreciate it when we are provided with a fully documented API Contract.

results.title: Web3
results.description:
The future has arrived, Web3 is here!
We have experience with Web3 and understand how valuable the use of Wallets and Encryption is for incoming technology.

results.title: KYC
results.description:
We are experienced in KYC methodologies and technologies.

We feel very proud to had the chance to provide a secured document validation by the use of NFC.

results.title: Streaming
results.description:
YouTube or Instagram will not be the only ones providing Live Streaming services.

We have experience with Live Streaming services like Agora to broadcast quality video to everyone in real time.

results.title: E-Commerce
results.description: When creating products that deal on a B2C, it is very important to work with payment platforms and methods, like Stripe and Apple Pay, and connect them with services like Shopify SDK.

results.title: Databases
results.description: We are also familiar with the experience of persisting data, Core Data, Realm, and now the brand new Swift Data combined with KeyChain for an extra layer of security for sensitive data.

results.title: Maps
results.description: Although it was brief, we also had the opportunity to work with maps and triangulation functions to provide efficient ways to calculate and fetch the best and closest events to a specific location.

results.title: Reactive
results.description: We are very familiar with reactive development and already have experience with RxSwift and took the big jump to native with Combine.

results.title: SwiftGen
results.description:
When dealing with a lot of resources we like to rely on SwiftGen to parse all of them.

Sometimes we also implement our own Stencil Templates to adjust the output to our needs.

results.title: OCR
results.description:
When perform KYC validations a great tool is to be able to parse your costumers documents by just taking a picture.

With that motivation in mind we are familiar with several OCR libraries.

results.title: Metal
results.description: When taking UI effects to the next level is vital to understand how to develop for the GPU, that is why we learned how to program our own shaders with Metal.

results.title: WebSockets
results.description:
There are SDKs like FireBase or Stream that provide an already active server for WebSockets connection.

But when pointing to a custom stateful server, we can create our own WebSockets as well as maintain a proper connection and evaluate its states.
